pros: Listens to employee feedback and adjusts when able
cons: small business growing pains in big field
advice_to_mgmt: keep it up, but don't lose sight of what helped you to this point

pros: Very accessible. Quick to provide assistance with challenges. Up front and honest. I have been with the company for less than a year but everyone from my first level manager to HR and HQ Execs have been helpful and upfront in replying to all of my questions. I feel like they are more like friends than upper level management.
cons: On the lower level salary wise, benefits are handled via a website with little hands on by the staff. It is still a small company and this is probably the most cost efficient so I understand but it is so much nicer when benefits are handled in company vice a second or third party entity.
advice_to_mgmt: I think you are doing great, keep going after quality people and I see tremendous growth for DGS.

pros: Benefits and pay are good. Always treated well
cons: When contract is up, contract is up. They won't even hold the insurance for 1 month
advice_to_mgmt: Expand you areas of business. There is a lot out you're missing.
